channel.title: Funtoo Linux distro
channel.description:
i have found some cool stuff inside this website , i wonder if the community of the distro useable to us (like Whonix based on it or on gentoo or on Qemu or so) , check out the link:-
http://www.funtoo.org/Welcome
[Windows 7 Virtualization with KVM](http://www.funtoo.org/Windows_7_Virtualization_with_KVM)
[Funtoo Containers](http://www.funtoo.org/Funtoo_Containers)

item.title: Funtoo Linux distro
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
as Funtoo is just a offspring from Gentoo and only differs in areas from
it, I don’t see any reason to specifically support it, especially
because their support of KVM is essentially the same we have in most
other modern “Linuxes”.

aha i c

Regarding Whonix on QEMU, existed once, was scrapped because of the bad
performance which not hardware accelerated emulation offers, see here: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/QEMU

yeah i know that, but thought because of the lack of the development not because QEMU is just bad idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Funtoo Linux distro
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

as Funtoo is just a offspring from Gentoo and only differs in areas from it, I don’t see any reason to specifically support it, especially because their support of KVM is essentially the same we have in most other modern “Linuxes”.

Regarding Whonix on QEMU, existed once, was scrapped because of the bad performance which not hardware accelerated emulation offers, see here: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/QEMU

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic

item.description:
i have found some cool stuff inside this website , i wonder if the community of the distro useable to us (like Whonix based on it or on gentoo or on Qemu or so) , check out the link:-

funtoo.org

Funtoo Linux

Funtoo Linux is a Gentoo-based OS that uses a git-based Portage tree. Run by Daniel Robbins, creator of Gentoo.

Windows 7 Virtualization with KVM

Funtoo Containers
